entries.meaning: (obsolete, UK, law) A large extent of ground; a perambulation; a circuit

verbs.description: wend (third-person singular simple present wends, present participle wending, simple past and past participle wended or (archaic) went)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To turn; change, to adapt.
(transitive) To direct (one's way or course); pursue one's way; proceed upon some course or way.
examples: We wended our weary way westward.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To turn; make a turn; go round; veer.
examples: with the prowe at both ends, so as they need not to wend or hold water

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To pass away; disappear; depart; vanish.
